Class Login

java.lang.Object
authentication.Login
public class Login extends Object
Handles user authentication by validating user credentials against the stored database.

This class is responsible for:

  • Authenticating users by email and password
  • Managing login state
  • Updating user's last login timestamp
  • Providing access to authenticated user information

The class reads user information from a JSON database file and validates the provided credentials against the stored data.

See Also:
  • Signup
  • Validation

  • Constructor Details

    • Login

      public Login(User user)
      Creates a login instance and attempts to authenticate the provided user.

      The constructor extracts email and password from the user object and automatically attempts authentication upon creation.

      Parameters:
      user - A User object containing the email and password credentials
      See Also:
      • User

  • Method Details

    • isLoggedIn

      public boolean isLoggedIn()
      Checks if the login attempt was successful.
      Returns:
      true if the user is authenticated, false otherwise

    • getLoggedInUser

      public User getLoggedInUser()
      Retrieves the authenticated user's information as a User object.

      This method creates a new User object with the authenticated user's username, password, and email information.

      Returns:
      a User object with the authenticated user's information, or null if not logged in
      See Also:
      • User

    • getLoggedInUserFilename

      public String getLoggedInUserFilename()
      Gets the filename associated with the authenticated user's data file.

      This filename is used to store and retrieve the user's personal budget data.

      Returns:
      the filename string for the authenticated user, or null if not logged in
